DataElement.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer American Joint Committee On Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary nasopharyngeal cancer based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to pathologic T stage of the nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/8/20 tmt added Registration Status.; 1/8/20 Received permission from Brian Campbell to transfer ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards. Changed workflow from retired to draft new with permission from CTEP to reuse with AJCC TMN stage CDEs. mc 10/3/13

ValueDomain.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of nasopharyngeal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with no evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with no evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor confined to the nasopharynx, or tumor extending to oropharynx and/or nasal cavity without parapharyngeal extension.  Parapharyngeal extension denotes posterolateral infiltration of tumor.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor confined to the nasopharynx, or tumor extending to oropharynx and/or nasal cavity without parapharyngeal extension.  Parapharyngeal extension denotes posterolateral infiltration of tumor.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with parapharyngeal extension.  Parapharyngeal extension denotes posterolateral infiltration of tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with parapharyngeal extension.  Parapharyngeal extension denotes posterolateral infiltration of tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor involving bony structures of skull base and/or paranasal sinuses. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor involving bony structures of skull base and/or paranasal sinuses. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with intracranial extension and/or involvement of cranial nerves, hypopharynx, orbit, or with extension to the infratemporal fossa/masticator space. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with intracranial extension and/or involvement of cranial nerves, hypopharynx, orbit, or with extension to the infratemporal fossa/masticator space. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTis TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of nasopharyngeal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
The extent of a cancer in the body.
